visualizations.title: Visualizations
visualizations.description: Configure how data is displayed on charts and graphs.

showNorms.title: Show Standardized Norms
showNorms.description: Display gender-based target zones (Masculine/Feminine/Androgynous) on charts.

accessibility.title: Accessibility
accessibility.description: Customize the interface for better visibility and readability.

fontSize.title: Font Size
fontSize.description: Adjust the text size of the application.

data.title: Data Management
data.description: Manage your local data, create backups, or reset the application.

export.title: Export Backup
export.description: Download all your progress and settings as a JSON file.

import.title: Import Backup
import.description: Restore data from a previously exported JSON file.
import.warning: WARNING: This will overwrite your current data with the backup. Are you sure?
import.error: Failed to restore data. Invalid file format.

reset.title: Factory Reset
reset.description: Permanently delete all data and reset the application.

training.title: Training Gym
training.description: Practice pitch, resonance, and intonation exercises.

assessment.title: Voice Assessment
assessment.description: Take a full assessment to track your progress.

analysis.title: Live Analysis
analysis.description: Real-time feedback on your speaking voice.

placeholder.title: Voice Analysis
placeholder.description: Record a voice sample to get detailed analysis of your pitch, resonance, and voice quality.
placeholder.instruction: Press the microphone button to start recording. Speak a few sentences for best results.

transcript.title: Color-Coded Transcript
transcript.error: Word-level analysis is unavailable. The transcription model could not be loaded. You can still view overall voice metrics in the other tabs.

descriptions.pitch: How high or low your voice sounds. Higher values are more feminine, lower values are more masculine.
descriptions.resonance: The 'brightness' or 'darkness' of your voice. Higher resonance typically sounds brighter and more feminine.
descriptions.rate: How fast you are speaking. Normal conversation is usually 3-5 syllables per second.
descriptions.jitter: Measures how steady your pitch is. Lower values mean a clearer voice.
descriptions.hnr: Harmonics-to-Noise Ratio. Higher values mean a clearer voice with less breathiness or hoarseness.
descriptions.shimmer: Measures how steady your volume is. Lower values mean a more stable voice.
descriptions.avgFormant: Average of your formant frequencies. Higher average correlates with feminine perception.
descriptions.cpps: Cepstral Peak Prominence. Higher values indicate a clearer, more resonant voice.
descriptions.spi: Soft Phonation Index. Higher values indicate a softer, breathier voice quality.
descriptions.slope: How quickly energy drops off at higher frequencies. Steeper slope (more negative) sounds softer/flutier.

mismatch.title: Resonance Mismatch Detected
mismatch.description: Your pitch is high, but your resonance (formants) is relatively low. This can sometimes sound "hollow" or unnatural. Try brightening your resonance by smiling slightly or raising your tongue.

toasts.backendUnavailable: Recording saved! Full analysis requires backend server.
toasts.cleanFail: Failed to clean audio. Is the backend running?

strengths.title: What Went Well
strengths.empty: Keep practicing to build your strengths!

training.title: Training Gym
training.subtitle: Targeted biofeedback exercises to build muscle memory.

pitchA3.title: Sustain A3
pitchA3.desc: Practice holding a steady A3 note (220Hz). Good for lower range stability.

pitchC4.title: Sustain C4
pitchC4.desc: Practice holding a steady Middle C (261Hz). A central target for many voices.

resonanceI.title: Bright /i/ Target
resonanceI.desc: Practice the /i/ (heed) vowel to maximize oral resonance and brightness.

intonationRising.title: Rising Intonation
intonationRising.desc: Practice the upward pitch slide used in questions.

intonationFalling.title: Falling Intonation
intonationFalling.desc: Practice the downward pitch slide used in statements.

intonationHill.title: Hill Pattern
intonationHill.desc: Practice the rise-and-fall pattern used for emphasis.

acoustic.title: Advanced Acoustic Analysis
acoustic.subtitle: Objective measures for spectral balance, voice quality, and glottal efficiency.

breathiness.title: Breathiness (GNE)
breathiness.desc: Measures glottal noise. Higher values indicate more breathy voice.

roughness.title: Roughness
roughness.desc: Measures irregularity in vibration. Higher values indicate hoarseness.

cpp.title: CPP (Cepstral Peak)
cpp.desc: Cepstral Peak Prominence. Higher values indicate better vocal quality (less dysphonia).

ltas.title: Long-Term Average Spectrum (LTAS)
ltas.desc: Use LTAS to analyze the spectral tilt of your voice over time.
ltas.fem: Feminization: Look for more energy in high frequencies (right side).
ltas.masc: Masculinization: Look for more energy in low frequencies (left side).

articulation.title: Articulation Practice
articulation.subtitle: Refine your consonant precision and vowel resonance.

sibilant.title: Sibilant Quality
sibilant.tip: For a sharper "S": Raise tongue tip, groove center, smile slightly.

phonetogram.title: Voice Range Profile
phonetogram.subtitle: Map your vocal capabilities by exploring your pitch and volume range.

help.title: How to use
help.step1: Start recording and make a soft "Ooo" sound. Glide from your lowest note to your highest note.
help.step2: Repeat the glide, but this time as loud as you comfortably can (without straining!).
help.step3: Try to fill in the middle area by singing at a comfortable volume.
help.step4: Stop recording to see your complete Voice Range Profile.

toast.noData: No data to save recorded yet.

elongation.label: Elongation (Stretch)
elongation.desc: Simulates the Cricothyroid (CT) muscle stretching the folds. Increases pitch.

mass.label: Mass (Thickness)
mass.desc: Simulates the Thyroarytenoid (TA) muscle thickening the folds. Lowers pitch, adds weight.

tension.label: Tension (Stiffness)
tension.desc: Simulates the stiffness of the vocal ligament and body.

adduction.label: Adduction (Closure)
adduction.desc: How tightly the folds come together. Low = Breathy, High = Pressed.

voiceQuality.title: Voice Quality Analysis
voiceQuality.subtitle: Clinical metrics for timbre and stability

upload.title: Upload Audio File
upload.desc: Select a recording (WAV, MP3) to analyze voice quality markers.

live.title: Live Clinical Analysis
live.desc: Start the microphone to analyze Jitter, Shimmer, HNR, and Spectral Tilt in real-time.

warning.title: Warning: Feedback Risk
warning.desc: This enables real-time audio monitoring. You MUST wear headphones to avoid loud feedback loops.

ready.title: Ready to Tune?
ready.desc: Select a vowel and hit Start to begin.

practiceCards.title: Practice Cards
practiceCards.createYourOwn: Create your own card sets below

activity.title: Card Activity
activity.subtitle: Practice history & stats
activity.startPracticing: Start practicing this card to track your progress

editor.validation: Please fill in the set name and at least one card

voiceAssessment.title: Voice Assessment
voiceAssessment.subtitle: Comprehensive analysis of your voice characteristics

baseline.title: The Rainbow Passage
baseline.instruction: Read the passage above at a comfortable pace. We'll analyze your pitch and range.

selfAssess.instruction: Record your voice, then rate how you think it sounds. We'll reveal the actual analysis!

quickCheck.title: Quick Voice Check
quickCheck.instruction: Get instant feedback on your current voice. Just speak for a few seconds!
